0.text: The world is getting happier and healthier
0.content: At the end of the cold war, the western bloc countries were the happiest and helathiest. The eastern bloc was lower on both scales, probably due to political and economical instability.

1.text: The world is getting happier healthier
1.content: In the 00s, the rest of the world starts to catch up to the west. Perceived health seems to improve more than happiness.

2.text: The world is getting happier healthier
2.content: Today, most nations score well on both metrics, with the notable exception of Egypt. It is not unreasonable to assume that the instability in the country since the arab spring might be one reason for this.

3.text: As trust wanes, willingness to fight increases
3.content: In the early 90s, trust in others was relatively high in the west, unlike the rest of the world. Willingness to fight for one's country is notably high in former soviet states and the nordic countries.

4.text: As trust wanes, willingness to fight increases
4.content: In the 00s, trust seems to be lower, though this could be explained by the lack of data from many western countries. Increased willingness to fight seems to be a global trend.

5.text: As trust wanes, willingness to fight increases
5.content: As we move on to the 2010s, the cluster does not move much, but the positions of individual countries change. Trust is low in latin america and subsaharan africa.

6.content: We see a strong correlation between financial an general satisfaction in life; though values vary, most countries fit on a straight line.

7.content: In the 00s , financial satisfaction lowers across the globe (once again, the reformed west is missing), but the spread still remains.

8.content: In the 2010s, we see that the differences in financial satisfaction reduce; this shows that developing countries are starting to cath up

9.content: Societies with stronger individual empowerment seem to adopt more secular values. Sweden leads the pack, with other countries in the reformed west closely behind.

10.content: As time moves on, we notice that South Korea moves further towards individual empowerment and secularization, as is the orthodox east.

11.content: In the last decade, Individual empowerment has lowered in the sinic east. We can also observe an increase in religious values in the islamic and orthodox east.
